name: Hampton Inn and Suites Providence / Warwick Airport

reviews.text: We had the opportunity to stay at the Hampton Inn this past weekend along with many other hockey families during our hockey tournament. As a veteran of many hockey tournament hotels, this stay was by far the best experience my family ever had. I was most please with Jay Visnjic, the Hotel Manager. He continually made himself available and went out of his way to help us out. Numerous times he walked around, with a pleasant smile and greeted us and wished us a good day. He arranged a spare meeting room for our kids to play in, he allowed us to use his lobby area to have team parties and arranged shuttle rides for a few families. I can go on and on with all that was done, but by far Jay and his staff we simply GREAT!
reviews.title: Thanks Jay!

reviews.text: I took the time to personally thank Jay, this is not something I commonly do. But with the experience we had, I was very glad to take the time to do so!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: If you are in need of a hotel in the Providence, RI area, this is a must stay.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites Providence/Warwick Airport for three nights. We were part of a group of several other adults and children. Our group was in RI for a hockey tournament for the kids. We can't say enough about how well this hotel is run by the General Manager Jay Visnjic. He ensured that our entire group had everything that we needed and Jay and his entire staff are extremely friendly and they all do an excellent job. The hotel rooms were spotless and the common areas of the hotel were just as clean. Jay and staff went above and beyond for us by making breakfast to go bags for our three hockey teams that had games at 7am and also made enough bags to go for all the family members of the teams. Also, if anyone has been at a hotel when hockey teams are staying there for a hockey tournament, they know that it's all about the knee hockey games! Jay played it very smart and allowed our teams full access to a very large conference room and the kids played knee hockey in that room from 9am to 9pm every day. Also,the General Manager Jay Visnjic definitely cares about his guests and goes above and beyond. We actually think that he must work 24 hours per day because we never saw him gone from the hotel! We would highly recommend this hotel for a group stay or any other type of stay that you may have.
reviews.title: Outstanding Even Under Difficult Conditions

reviews.text: Front desk clerk Brittany and hotel manager Jay treated me exceptionally good. I had an unusual request and the hotel accomodated my request w/pleasure. Thank you so much for your hospitality.
reviews.title: H-E- Double Hockey Sticks

reviews.text: Traveled to Rhode Island to attend a family funeral, and stayed at the Hampton Inn near the Providence airport for convenience. The hotel was literally right next to the airport, and was a 10 minute (if that) walk. Yes, when we needed our morning caffeine fix, we walked to the Starbucks located right by the airport check in on both mornings that we were there.
reviews.title: Sometimes a bed is all you need

reviews.text: The thing with the Hampton Inn is that you know what you are getting - which makes traveling easy. No unknowns - usually. The room was quite large, and the bed was ridiculously comfortable - almost impossible for me to wake up and get out of bed. The place was very quiet which was surprising as we noticed that a high school group (some sport team) was also staying there - and we feared late night hallway noise - which if it happened, we heard nothing. The inn did offer free breakfast in the morning but it all looked a bit scary - food sitting in bins is never appealing. Thus the walk to Starbucks each morning.
reviews.title: Best Hampton Inn !

reviews.text: All in all - the Hampton Inn is realiable - and when all you need is a bed, it's one of the better options at a decent price.
reviews.title: 5 Star Experience

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn at the Providence Airport at the end of March. I was worried that it might be too noisy since it was at the airport, but no worries! It was quiet and Mike, at the front desk, was very helpful in pointing out places for dinner and also sites to visit in the area. We have stayed in many wonderful hotels, but this Hampton Inn rates with the best. The lobby features a mini-bar and comfortable places to sit and relax. The hotel has free wifi - a must for most people today - and has a lovely pool and spa. There is a guest laundry, exercise room, and a wonderful breakfast, too! If you are staying in this area, I would highly recommend this Hampton Inn .... and tell Mike hello!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: My friend and I were traveling through PVD and had a late arriving flight and did not feel like making a late drive back to Boston. So we decided to crash at the Hampton Inn nearby. We recieved a warm welcome from the shuttle driver George, who was more than happy to pick us up at the airport, and was waiting for us as soon as we exited the airport! Upon arival it looked to be an airline crew checking in, and we would be waiting a while to check in. However, Monica came out to imediatly assisted us, and got us booked into a spacious suite, and had a great recomindation of a sushi place near by, which we later tried and enjoyed that evening! Befor heading out, we were surprised to stumble across at a bar at the Hampton Inn. The selection was not that large, However Matt the bartender was able to make some great drinks with what he had and put a new spin on a Margarita with Midori, that I really enjoyed! We later enjoyed breakfast the next morning, again the staff was very helpfull, and its always nice to recieve a free full breakfast, compared to other hotels which may charge $20. They also had a great pool and xtra large hot tub which was also relaxing. We woke up feeling very refreshed, the next day, and enjoyed our ride back to boston, a great way to wind the down from a vacation. I will definatly consider making this a habbit for my late night flights in the future!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: My hubby had a late dinner and early following morning seminar in Warwick so it was easier for him to just stay overnight, and myself and 2 kids decided to go with him. I researched several hotels and it was the pool area that made my decision. I was pleasantly surprised at how new everything looked, and the cleanliness, as others have previously written.The beds were very comfortable, the pillows were ok...I'm a pillow person and needed 3. The linens were nice, all bright white, no stains. Bathrooms were pretty simple, no granite or anything but they were clean. The free parking, free wi/fi and free hot breakfast was a complete bonus! The breakfast space was kept very clean with a young girl who seemed very nice. My kids had the make your own waffes, big hit. They also have a little bar open at night in the area where b'fast is served. It has a little flat screen TV. I could see hubby and myself stopping in for a cocktail if we didn't have the kids with us. Our room had some views of planes taking off and my kids thought that was really "cool." And considering we were so close to the airport, you could hear the planes taking off in our direction, but it was muted, and with the sound of the TV, no-one really noticed it. The TV's were great, HUGE, flat screens and my 10 yr old thought it offered a good variety of kids channels. My 5 yr old son was excited when he saw he could play Mario video games, but they cost money, so we didn't do it. That was fine, they kept busy using the pool (which we had all to ourselves both times we used it.) The pool was a great size and the hot tub was very big for a hot tub. It looks onto the parking lot, which is a little awkward knowing people can watch you (but really, the lot wasn't full of cars going in and out so it wasn't that bad), but with floor to ceiling windows, it allows for a lot of natural light. And the surround sound music was a really nice touch. We did notice some floating chunks of dark hair/lint in the pool the second day which was kind of gross. Hopefully it was on a due-to-be-cleaned schedule, but the hot tub was very clean and very relaxing! It's in a great location for people flying in for business, etc. as there's several options for restaurants in many different price categories. We had dinner at Bertucci's that night, very family friendly and good food. And lunch the next day at Iron Works, a bit upscale for kids, but great lunch prices (house glass of merlot was $3.25). Both places within 3 minutes.We will definitely stay here again if we need to be in Warwick again!!
reviews.title: Convenient, clean, updated!

reviews.text: Providence offers a lot of hotels for business travelers. Rather than deal with the hassle of staying downtown and have to pay for someone to valet park my car in/out daily, I chose this hotel, only a short drive from downtown.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: This hotel is very modern and extremely clean. All of the staff members were extremely courteous and helpful. Brittany checked me in on my arrival and was very detail-oreinted in my requests for my room.
reviews.title: Management And Services Were Great

reviews.text: The hotel has a large atrium and a bar area. Yes, a real bar. One of the few Hampton Inns that has one.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: Everything was modern and very clean. The hotel offers a larger than usual workout area + an indoor pool and hot tub. Very nice. The hotel is located next to the Providence airport -- the hotel is so well insulated that you would never know it.
reviews.title: Shockingly, a very great place to stay!

reviews.text: You couldn't ask for anything more from a hotel than what the Hamptons offered. It was clean, the staff was great, breakfast was wonderful. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: What a weekend

reviews.text: Our hockey team stayed at this hotel this past weekend. The hotel was very accommodating with our rooms and our players. The general manager, Jay Visnjic, couldn't do enough for our association. We had our own "knee hockey" room and he was at our service the whole time. The rooms were very clean and when I ran out of something, they were there in a heartbeat. He and his staff always had a smile. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to say in the Warwick, Providence, RI area. The breakfast each morning was great and I loved the coffee all day! He even provided bagged breakfasts because we had to leave one morning before breakfast for a game. 100 thumbs up!!!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel and manager!!!

reviews.text: As friendly a stay as we could have imagined. We had a surprise birthday party here that the staff helped make a big success. Special thanks to Deneka for her help.
reviews.title: We love you

reviews.text: Brittany greeted us at the front desk. She was pleasant, friendly and extremely professional. We had reserved a suite but due to some minor mistake we got a regular room. She immediately made the change for us with no problem. We were staying there for a Hockey Tournament so needless to say there were plenty of kids in the hotel. They gave the kids a conference room to p;lay in and keep them busy in between games. The hotel staff was excellent with all the kids around and never uttered a cross word. The pool was well maintained and the hours quite convenient. The same was true for the health room and the equipment there. The continental breakfast was superb and plentiful. The hotel was kept clean at all times and the parking lot was well lit. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. It is conveniently located and we had to travel to several different rinks so the easy on/off to the highway was great. My compliments to the staff and especially Brittany for making me and my family feel at home.
reviews.title: A Stay at Perfection

reviews.text: We decided to choose this hotel based on the reviews that we read, and sure enough this place was exactly what everyone states. It is a beautiful hotel, with great employees. When we arrived, our suite was ready so we were able to check in right away. It was a one king bedroom suite with a pull-out sofa. In the room, there is a small kitchen with a microwave, stove and even a dish washer and full size fridge. It also has a small dinning room table to sit and eat your meals on. The room was very spacious, with 2 huge flat screen tv's and a king bed that was a pleasure to sleep on. The bathroom was very awkward. The lights were located outside of the bathroom and on the opposite wall. So, if you are staying with people, it was very easy for them to play a joke and turn off the lights while you are showering or using the bathroom. The sink is located outside of the bathroom, next to the bedroom. This place is about 15 minutes from downtown, not a bad car ride. There is no shuttle to take you downtown, you are better off parking in a local lot. The taxi services will cost you at least $20.00 one way. The hotel also has a ginormous pool and hot tub in the hotel. Also, they offer a continental breakfast in the morning. This consisted of pastries, cereals and other quick things like eggs, waffles juices etc. We were concerned about hearing the airplanes at night, we didn't hear anything. So, if you are visiting Providence, or are coming in from the airport, i would recommend this hotel 100%.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL!
